snippet: Nine New Yorkers recounted their frustrations with the city, with a small-business owner saying his bill jumped to $10,000 from $1,000.
abstract: New Yorkers recount their frustrations with the city's Environmental Protection Dept, which manages the city's water meters, at a public hearing organized by public advocate Bill de Blasio; hearing was spurred by hundreds of bills collected by deBlasio from customers who complained about unfair billing by the department.
lead_paragraph: Nine New Yorkers recounted their frustrations with the city, with a small-business owner saying his bill jumped to $10,000 from $1,000.

headline.seo: At a Public Hearing, Customers Complain of Unfair Billing for Water
headline.main: At Hearing, Customers Complain of Unfair and Inaccurate Water Bills
